channel.title: Hague Steadicam / BM Trailer Theme
channel.description:
Hey guys, I just bought a Hague DSLR Steadicam for my 550D (T2i). It's brilliant! A must-have for any aspiring film-makers. :3
After using it for a few hours the motion reminded me of the first BM trailer. With that in mind, I put together this little test with Joel Nielson's fantastic tune. :stuck_out_tongue:
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O04hGvx5Nss&hd=1'][b][u]Steadicam Time![/u][/b][/url]
It's by no means amazing; just a couple of minutes work to see how the steadicam would perform in the context of a film. :slight_smile:

item.title: Hague Steadicam / BM Trailer Theme
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
Haha, how did the laundry remind you of that? :3

In less than two weeks I have to make a professional-standard documentary for my school…lots of steadicam and tripod shots are in order…

item.title: Hague Steadicam / BM Trailer Theme
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
Haha, bare in mind that it takes a while to get used to it and I shot that video after only a few hours. With more practice, shots could be superb.

They’re definitely worth it though if you’re looking to get a more professional film-look or for dream-like sequences.

item.title: Hague Steadicam / BM Trailer Theme
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
Hey guys, I just bought a Hague DSLR Steadicam for my 550D (T2i). It’s brilliant! A must-have for any aspiring film-makers. :3

After using it for a few hours the motion reminded me of the first BM trailer. With that in mind, I put together this little test with Joel Nielson’s fantastic tune.

Steadicam Time!

It’s by no means amazing; just a couple of minutes work to see how the steadicam would perform in the context of a film.
